wikipedia_page.main:
Not to be confused with George Frederic Watts.

George Fiddes Watt (15 February 1873 – 22 November 1960) was a Scottish portrait painter and engraver.

response: His full length portrait (in military uniform) by George Fiddes Watt is held at Edinburgh City Chambers.https://www.artuk.org/discover/artworks/sir-john-lorne-macleod-18731946-cbe-lld-lord-provost-19161919-93965

link_mentions.page: List of painters by name beginning with "W"
response: *George Fiddes Watt (1873–1960), Scottish painter and engraver
*George Fiddes Watt (1873–1960), portrait painter and engraver
On his retirement, Laurie's admirers presented him with the portrait oil painting by George Fiddes Watt (see illustration). The painting is now in the University of Edinburgh Fine Art Collection.
* Art UK: Paintings: Simon Somerville Laurie by George Fiddes Watt, 1904
*Thomas Martin Lindsay portrait by George Fiddes Watt at bbc.co.uk

Other artists who exhibited at the gallery include Frank Brangwyn, John Lavery, William Orpen, Christopher Nevinson, Ben Nicholson, Glyn Philpot, William Bruce Ellis Ranken, Frank Salisbury, John Singer Sargent, James Jebusa Shannon and George Fiddes Watt.
He was knighted by King George V during his period as Lord Provost. His full-length portrait by George Fiddes Watt is held by the City of Edinburgh Council.
Works of art in the town hall include a portrait by George Fiddes Watt of the former provost, John Melrose.
He was portrayed in his Lord Provost robes by George Fiddes Watt.https://artuk.org/discover/artworks/william-slater-brown-lord-provost-19091912-93968
